name: Discourage Search Engines Notifier
author: Simplecode.cz

sections.description: Effortlessly monitor your site’s search engine visibility with the Discourage Search Engines Notifier plugin. This lightweight tool adds a clear red or green eye icon to your admin bar, instantly indicating whether your site is hidden from search engines. No complex setup required—simply install the plugin, and you’re all set! Click the icon to quickly access the Discourage Search Engines settings page. Simplify your SEO management with just a glance!
sections.installation:
1. Download the plugin from the plugin directory.
  2. Navigate to Plugins, then click on Add New.
  3. Click on Upload.
  4. Find the file you downloaded (discourage-search-engines-notifier.zip) and upload it.
  5. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
sections.faq:
What does the plugin do?

Discourage Search Engines Notifier helps you easily monitor the visibility status of your WordPress site for search engines by displaying an eye icon in the admin bar.

How do I use the plugin?

Once installed and activated, the plugin adds a red or green eye icon to your WordPress admin bar. Clicking on the icon will take you directly to the Search Engine Visibility settings page.

Does the plugin require any configuration?

No. The plugin works out of the box with no additional setup required.

How do I know if my site is visible to search engines?

A red eye icon means your site is not visible to search engines, while a green eye icon indicates your site is visible.

Can I donate to support development?

Yes, you can support the development of this plugin by donating via Ko-fi.

short_description: Never forget to turn off Discourage Search Engines visibility again. Just activate the plugin and that's it.
